channel.title: Axoloti in the woods (session 2)
channel.description:
Hi, I've just recorded a new walk in the woods, playing my last axoloti creation, the ribbon synth. I use a single patch that includes a panel of different oscillators, feeding into 4 delay lines. It also includes the element reverb.
https://youtu.be/bTumk8y_9T4
I've also managed to control solenoids using the axoloti, but still need to work on the mechanical side of things. Here is a video with me using it, synchronized to the same ribbon synth patch. You can't see it much, and I've put it quite behind in the mix, as it mainly hits a tambourine, and I'm not a big fan of the sound
https://youtu.be/bwK979ooswQ

item.title: Axoloti in the woods (session 2)
item.dc:creator: @mtyas Matthew Tyas
item.description:
@mtyas wrote:

The solenoids I use are 12v, and I don't use relay, but a home made simple circuit made with a transistor, a diode and a resistor.
You need to test your power supply by wiring up it up directly to a solenoid. If it moves, then the power supply and the solenoid isn't at fault.
I don't know what your relay module board is, and if it what kind of control voltage it requires, but if (as I read on the other thread) the leds light up, then I suppose it is working. Make sure all polarities are right, and that they work without using the relay (and that the power supply produces enough current).

Read full topic

item.title: Axoloti in the woods (session 2)
item.dc:creator: @wishniak
item.description:
@wishniak wrote:

how did it work out wih the solenoids? im trying to get some going here, but have no luck (not sure if its my 24v power supply or the 8 relay module board im using etc.. ). anything youve learned would be helpful

Read full topic
